verses.kjv: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled, the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
verses.ct: During the 1st year of King Cyrus of Persia, the LORD moved the heart of Cyrus so that what the LORD had spoken through Jeremiah would come true. Cyrus sent an announcement across his entire kingdom and also had it written down, saying:

verses.kjv: Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, The LORD God of heaven hath given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he hath charged me to build him an house at Jerusalem, which is in Judah.
verses.ct: "This is what King Cyrus of Persia declares: The LORD God of heaven has handed all the kingdoms of the earth over to me, and he has appointed me to build a temple for him in Jerusalem, which is in Judah."

verses.kjv: Who is there among you of all his people? his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and build the house of the LORD God of Israel, (he is the God,) which is in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: "Anyone among you who belongs to his people — may his God be with him — should travel up to Jerusalem in Judah and build the temple of the LORD God of Israel, the true God, who is in Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: And whosoever remaineth in any place where he sojourneth, let the men of his place help him with silver, and with gold, and with goods, and with beasts, beside the freewill offering for the house of God that is in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: "Whoever is left in any place where they have been living, the people of that area should support them with silver, gold, supplies, and livestock, along with voluntary contributions for the temple of God in Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: Then rose up the chief of the fathers of Judah and Benjamin, and the priests, and the Levites, with all them whose spirit God had raised, to go up to build the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Then the family leaders of Judah and Benjamin, along with the priests and the Levites — everyone whose spirit God had stirred — got ready to go up and build the temple of the LORD in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And all they that were about them strengthened their hands with vessels of silver, with gold, with goods, and with beasts, and with precious things, beside all that was willingly offered.
verses.ct: All their neighbors supported them with silver articles, gold, supplies, livestock, and valuable gifts, in addition to everything that was given voluntarily.

verses.kjv: Also Cyrus the king brought forth the vessels of the house of the LORD, which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of Jerusalem, and had put them in the house of his gods;
verses.ct: King Cyrus also brought out the items from the temple of the LORD that Nebuchadnezzar had taken from Jerusalem and placed in the temple of his own gods.

verses.kjv: Even those did Cyrus king of Persia bring forth by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and numbered them unto Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.
verses.ct: King Cyrus of Persia had these brought out through Mithredath the treasurer, who counted them and handed them over to Sheshbazzar, the leader of Judah.

verses.kjv: And this is the number of them: thirty chargers of gold, a thousand chargers of silver, nine and twenty knives,
verses.ct: Here is the inventory: 30 gold platters, 1,000 silver platters, 29 knives,

verses.kjv: Thirty basons of gold, silver basons of a second sort four hundred and ten, and other vessels a thousand.
verses.ct: 30 gold bowls, 410 silver bowls of a secondary type, and 1,000 other articles.

verses.kjv: All the vessels of gold and of silver were five thousand and four hundred. All these did Sheshbazzar bring up with them of the captivity that were brought up from Babylon unto Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The total number of gold and silver articles came to 5,400. Sheshbazzar brought all of these along when the exiles traveled from Babylon up to Jerusalem.
